a way of walking or moving using long, relaxed steps: The trot quickly became a lope, which just as quickly became a gallop. She crossed the field with the easy lope of a woman half her age.
More examplesFewer examplesShe walked round Gabriel with a wolfish lope.Dropping to a steady lope, the pack had run on deep into the forest.He set off at a fast lope, leaving her amazed that he still had enough energy to move so quickly.
